page.title: 11The Maltster's Arms, Amble
page.content: {Eighty}years ago the pub at Amble lost its licence. In{1964}the new owners of the house obtained a public house licence again. The present owner has had the business for{fifteen years.} {Holiday makers}are attracted to the pub because of its low ceilings, its very quaint appearance and its reputation for{good food.}There are three rooms served from the main bar. Upstairs is a{restaurant}seating about 20 people.{Bar snacks}are also served in the bar but children under the age of 14 must stay in the children's room. As food is served dogs are not allowed in. A free house, it has many{ {regulars}from the village and the region. Some tourists come back to Amble year after year and re_visit the pub. Opening time is from 11am to 2.30pm. It re_opens at 6pm and closes at 11pm.
